definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: They point to an example that is well known to supply-chain mavens.
sentences.chinese: 一个很切题的例子许多供应链专家都知道。

sentences.english: Your answer is not to the point.
He also responds to email questions that are short and to the point.
sentences.chinese: 并且他所回复的邮件都是十分简短切题的。

sentences.english: What you write should keep to the point.
What you have just said is beside the mark.
sentences.chinese: 你刚才所说的是不切题的。

sentences.english: His articles just stick to the topic.
Don’t brag, make sure they are relevant to the conversation.
Your response should be broad and synthetic;
sentences.chinese: 你的回答必须广且切题。

sentences.english: That is, well, excuse my hesitation, far off the point.
sentences.chinese: 那个，呃，请原谅我的犹豫，很不切题。

definition: to digress/to stray from the subject
words do not convey the meaning/poorly expressed/senseless/inarticulate
to express or convey one's ideas
to bring out the main theme/to make the point/to bring out the substance concisely
to get off the main topic/to digress
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
to rhyme/sometimes written 壓韻|压韵
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
